docs.title: Databricks Deep Dive — Lakehouse Patterns, DLT & SQL
docs.text:
What this page covers

A pragmatic reference you can skim during interviews or reuse in projects: ingestion → quality → medallion modeling → governance → performance → cost. All examples are SQL‑first, with quick Python tabs where helpful.

docs.title: TL;DR Architecture (Medallion + Governance)
docs.text:
```mermaid %%{ init: { "flowchart": { "nodeSpacing": 50, "rankSpacing": 70 } } }%% flowchart LR %% Groups subgraph Sources A1[Batch files (CSV/Parquet)] A2[Kafka/Kinesis] A3[DB CDC] end

subgraph Ingestion B1[Auto Loader] B2[COPY INTO] B3[Streaming Reads] end

subgraph Bronze C1[Raw Delta Tables] end

subgraph Silver D1[Cleaned & Conformed] end

subgraph Gold E1[Aggregates & Marts] end

subgraph Governance UC[Unity Catalog Catalog/Schema/Table, ACLs, Lineage, Tags] end

%% Flows A1 --> B1 A2 --> B1 A3 --> B1 B1 --> C1 B2 --> C1 B3 --> C1 C1 --> D1 D1 --> E1 UC -. manages .- C1 UC -. manages .- D1 UC -. manages .- E1

%% Styling class A1,A2,A3 src; class B1,B2,B3 ing; class C1 bronze; class D1 silver; class E1 gold; class UC gov;

classDef src fill:#eef7ff,stroke:#1f6feb,stroke-width:1px; classDef ing fill:#f6f8fa,stroke:#57606a,stroke-width:1px; classDef bronze fill:#fff3e0,stroke:#c77800,stroke-width:1px; classDef silver fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#9e9e9e,stroke-width:1px; classDef gold fill:#fff8e1,stroke:#b59f3b,stroke-width:1px; classDef gov fill:#f0e6ff,stroke:#6e40c9,stroke-width:1px;
